Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partly grey-black in section, the interior is thickly covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and bears the remains of the ends of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393300) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393300)
